definition: the New Year festival
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off

sentences.english: What did Mary do on Youth Day?
sentences.chinese: 䧥玛丽在青年节做了什么事？

sentences.english: The Chinese Youth Day commemorates the May 4th Movement thar happened in 1919.
sentences.chinese: 中国青年节是纪念1919年发生的五四运动的日子。

sentences.english: Folk happy when lunar new year's season jubilation makes the eight-treasure rice pudding edible.
sentences.chinese: 民间喜在年节喜庆时做成八河北有哪些特产宝饭食用。

sentences.english: The festival is the populace entertainment festival.
sentences.chinese: 年节更是民众娱乐狂欢的节日。

sentences.english: This is the best way to exude confidence and make sales.
sentences.chinese: 这就是最好的信心，使年节销售。

sentences.english: On Youth Day, I joined the League. (
The festival was held by the Dong people to celebrate the harvest, according to the local media.
sentences.chinese: 当地媒体报导，侗年节是为了庆祝丰收。

sentences.english: Three coaches flung off the tracks by the force of the impact alone;
sentences.chinese: 仅只受撞击的影响，就有五月节中秋年节车箱出轨。

sentences.english: What did you do on Youth Day?
sentences.chinese: 你在青年节做了什么事？

sentences.english: Wen encourages Chinese youths on Youth Day eve.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝在五四青年节前夕鼓励学生奋发向上。

sentences.english: It is Youth Day. Wish all the young people good luck.
sentences.chinese: 今天是五四青年节，祝青年朋友们好运。

sentences.english: Do you know the story of "Youth Day"?
sentences.chinese: 你知道五四青年节的由来吗？

sentences.english: Because it's also known now as Youth Day. So you see.
sentences.chinese: 因为这个节日还被称为是青年节，所以你明白了。

sentences.english: What did Marry do on Youth Day?
sentences.chinese: 青年节玛丽做了什么事情？

sentences.english: If there is a Five-day Internation Youth Festival, are you interested to join?
sentences.chinese: 假若有一个五天的国际青年节，你会否参加？

definition: at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
festival
to visit one's friends and relatives
Spring Festival (Chinese New Year)
merchandise sold for Chinese New Year
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
holiday/festival/CL:個|个[ge4]
to kill the pigs and slaughter the sheep (idiom)
festive day/holiday
lunar New Year's Eve
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
twelfth lunar month
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
